00149     enum {
00150         /*
00151          * @brief The item view type returned by {@link Adapter#getItemViewType(int)} 
00152          * when the provider does not want the item's view recycled.
00153          */
00154         ITEM_VIEW_TYPE_IGNORE = -1,
00155 
00156         /*
00157          * @brief The item view type returned by {@link Adapter#getItemViewType(int)} 
00158          * when the item is a header or footer.
00159          */
00160         ITEM_VIEW_TYPE_HEADER_OR_FOOTER = -2,
00161 
00162         /*
00163          * @brief Sync based on the selected child
00164          */
00165         SYNC_SELECTED_POSITION = 0,
00166 
00167         /*
00168          * @brief Sync based on the first child displayed
00169          */
00170         SYNC_FIRST_POSITION = 1,
00171 
00172         /*
00173          * @brief Maximum amount of time to spend in {@link #findSyncPosition()}
00174          */
00175         SYNC_MAX_DURATION_MILLIS = 100,
00176 
00177         /*
00178          * @brief Represents an invalid position. All valid positions are in the range 0 to 1 less than the
00179          * number of items in the current provider.
00180          */
00181         INVALID_POSITION = -1,
00182 
00183         /*
00184          * @brief Represents an empty or invalid row id
00185          */
00186         INVALID_ROW_ID = LLONG_MIN,
00187 
00191         INVALID_COLUMN_ID = LLONG_MIN
00192     };

00692     /*
00693      * Smoothly scroll to the specified adapter position. The view will scroll
00694      * such that the indicated position is displayed <code>offset</code> pixels
00695      * from the top edge of the view. If this is impossible,  (e.g. the offset
00696      * would scroll the first or last item beyond the boundaries of the list) it
00697      * will get as close as possible. The scroll will take <code>duration</code>
00698      * milliseconds to complete.
00699      *
00700      * @param position Position to scroll to
00701      * @param offset Desired distance in pixels of <code>position</code> from
00702      * the top of the view when scrolling is finished
00703      * @param duration Number of milliseconds to use for the scroll
00704      *
00705      */
00706     void smoothScrollToPositionFromTop(int position, int offset, int duration);
00707 
00708      /*
00709       * Smoothly scroll to the specified adapter position. The view will scroll
00710       * such that the indicated position is displayed <code>offset</code> pixels
00711       * from the top edge of the view. If this is impossible,  (e.g. the offset
00712       * would scroll the first or last item beyond the boundaries of the list)
00713       * it will get as close as possible.
00714       *
00715       * @param position Position to scroll to
00716       * @param offset Desired distance in pixels of <code>position</code> from
00717       * the top of the view when scrolling is finished
00718       **/
00719     void smoothScrollToPositionFromTop(int position, int offset);

01037     /* @brief Get the position within the provider's data set for the Widget, where Widget is a an provider item
01038      * or a descendant of an provider item.
01039      *
01040      * @param Widget an provider item, or a descendant of an provider item. This must be visible in this
01041      *        AbsListWidget at the time of the call.
01042      * @return the position within the provider's data set of the Widget, or {@link #INVALID_POSITION}
01043      *         if the Widget does not correspond to a list item (or it is not currently visible).
01044      */
01045     virtual int32_t getPositionForWidget(gaia::core::Widget *widget);
01046

01052      */

01058      * @return The position within the provider's data set
01059      */
01060     virtual int32_t getLastVisiblePosition();
01061 
01062     /* @brief Searches the provider for a position matching mSyncRowId. The search starts at mSyncPosition
01063      * and then alternates between moving up and moving down until 1) we find the right position, or
01064      * 2) we run out of time, or 3) we have looked at every position
01065      *
01066      * @return Position of the row that matches mSyncRowId, or {@link #INVALID_POSITION} if it can't
01067      *          be found
01068      */
01069     virtual int32_t findSyncPosition();
01070 
01071     /* @brief Find a position that can be selected (i.e., is not a separator).
01072      *
01073      * @param position The starting position to look at.
01074      * @param lookDown Whether to look down for other positions.
01075      * @return The next selectable position starting at position and then
01076      * searching either up or
01077      *         down. Returns {@link #INVALID_POSITION} if nothing can be found.
01078      */
01079     virtual int32_t lookForSelectablePosition(int32_t position, bool);
01080 
01081     /* @brief Call the OnItemClickListener, if it is defined.

01087      *         called, false otherwise is returned.

01336 
01337 /* @class ListWidgetOnItemClickListener
01338  * Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when an item in this
01339  * providerView has been clicked.
01340  */
01341 class OnItemClickListenerProxy;
01342 class ListWidgetOnItemClickListener {
01343   public:
01344     ListWidgetOnItemClickListener();
01345     virtual ~ListWidgetOnItemClickListener();
01346 
01347     /*
01348      * Callback method to be invoked when an item in this providerView has
01349      * been clicked.
01350      * <p>
01351      * Implementers can call getItemAtPosition(position) if they need
01352      * to access the data associated with the selected item.
01353      *
01354      * @param parent The providerView where the click happened.
01355      * @param view The view within the providerView that was clicked (this
01356      *            will be a view provided by the provider)
01357      * @param position The position of the view in the provider.
01358      * @param id The row id of the item that was clicked.
01359      */
01360     virtual void onItemClick(gaia::ui::AbsListWidget *pParent,
01361         gaia::core::Widget *pWidget, int32_t position, int64_t id) = 0;
01362 
01363     OnItemClickListenerProxy *getProxy() const;
01364 
01365   private:
01366     OnItemClickListenerProxy *mpProxy;
01367     DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN(ListWidgetOnItemClickListener);
01368 };
01369 
01370 /*Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when an item in this
01371  * view has been clicked and held.
01372  */
01373 class OnItemLongClickListenerProxy;
01374 class ListWidgetOnItemLongClickListener {
01375   public:
01376     ListWidgetOnItemLongClickListener();
01377     virtual ~ListWidgetOnItemLongClickListener();
01378 
01379     /*Callback method to be invoked when an item in this view has been
01380      * clicked and held.
01381      *
01382      * Implementers can call getItemAtPosition(position) if they need to access
01383      * the data associated with the selected item.
01384      *
01385      * @param parent The AbsListView where the click happened
01386      * @param view The view within the AbsListView that was clicked
01387      * @param position The position of the view in the list
01388      * @param id The row id of the item that was clicked
01389      *
01390      * @return true if the callback consumed the long click, false otherwise
01391      */
01392     virtual bool onItemLongClick(gaia::ui::AbsListWidget *parent,
01393             gaia::core::Widget *view, int32_t position, int64_t id) = 0;
01394 
01395     gaia::ui::OnItemLongClickListenerProxy *getProxy() const;
01396 
01397   private:
01398     gaia::ui::OnItemLongClickListenerProxy *mpProxy;
01399     DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN(ListWidgetOnItemLongClickListener);
01400 };
01401 
01402 /*
01403  *Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when
01404  * an item in this view has been selected.
01405  */
01406 class OnItemSelectedListenerProxy;
01407 class ListWidgetOnItemSelectedListener {
01408   public:
01409     ListWidgetOnItemSelectedListener();
01410     virtual ~ListWidgetOnItemSelectedListener();
01411     /* @brief Callback method to be invoked when an item in this view has been
01412      * selected.
01413      *
01414      * Impelmenters can call getItemAtPosition(position) if they need to access the
01415      * data associated with the selected item.
01416      *
01417      * @param parent The providerView where the selection happened
01418      * @param view The view within the providerView that was clicked
01419      * @param position The position of the view in the provider
01420      * @param id The row id of the item that is selected
01421      */
01422     virtual void onItemSelected(gaia::ui::AbsListWidget *parent,
01423             gaia::core::Widget *view, int32_t position, int64_t id) = 0;
01424 
01425     /* @brief Callback method to be invoked when the selection disappears from this
01426      * view. The selection can disappear for instance when touch is activated
01427      * or when the provider becomes empty.
01428      *
01429      * @param parent The providerView that now contains no selected item.
01430      */
01431     virtual void onNothingSelected(gaia::ui::AbsListWidget *parent) = 0;
01432 
01433     gaia::ui::OnItemSelectedListenerProxy *getProxy() const;
01434 
01435   private:
01436     gaia::ui::OnItemSelectedListenerProxy *mpProxy;
01437     DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN(ListWidgetOnItemSelectedListener);
01438 };
01439 };  // for namespace ui
01440 };  // for namespace gaia
